commitResults.messageTitle: Abstracted DukeBot, Implemented greet and bye
commitResults.messageBody:
Abstracted DukeBot

Made Duke class solely the entry point to the program
Bot functions abstracted into DukeBot class
Localisations implemented by Messages class

Done so to ensure DukeBot can be instanced, rather than only keep track of 1 state of Duke


Implement basic greet and bye

Duke can now say hello and goodbye before exiting

commitResults.messageTitle: Add ability to parse commands, implement echo and exit
commitResults.messageBody:
Add Parser class to deal with input commands
* Also keeps track of whether the command is to exit for now

Add Echo and Exit, implementing Command interface
* Command is an interface with a single method execute() to unify all commands
* Echo is a placeholder command, to be deprecated in next release
More appropriate name to reflect use of class in future

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor UI strings, Change echo to add
commitResults.messageBody:
Refactor strings used for UI for better reference

Rename echo class to add
* No functionality implemented

Add skeleton classes ListCommand and TaskList
Update parser to accept list

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix typo in UI strings, Remove extra modifier from interface

commitResults.messageBody:
Implemented add and list functionality
* Changed method signature for Command.execute to accept taskList

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Duke to use Task, fix numbering with list

commitResults.messageBody:
Introduce done command to Parser
Enabled TaskList to mark tasks as done
Updated strings

Replaced undone Task printing unicode ✘ with letter X to maintain fixed-width on some consoles

commitResults.messageTitle: Added Deadline, Event, Todo task skeletons

commitResults.messageBody:
Add new commands for todo, event, deadline
* Extends add, superclass used to update task list

Add new InvalidCommandException
* Used when the command passed to Duke is not understood

Handle InvalidCommandException in DukeBot

Made the list command more human friendly
Default message when there are no tasks

Add tests using I/O redirection
Modify test scripts to compile with UTF-8 encoding
* Allows ✓ in Task to be recognized
Throw exception when the scanner cannot find any tokens (i.e. only whitespace entered)

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix whitespace in todo output, Update tests
commitResults.messageBody:
Fix extra whitespace appearing in todo tasks
* Update tests to reflect this

Add a few more tests to ensure proper rejection of garbage input

DukeException will collect all exceptions related to Duke

Move InvalidCommand message to DukeString
Add new exceptions for invalid task description and invalid task number

Implement InvalidTask and EmptyDescription exceptions
* Check if done is specified with no number/invalid number
* Check that task is not specified with empty description

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix styling issues across all classes
commitResults.messageBody:
Minor styling pass, mostly marking parameters as final for safety
Ensure DukeString cannot be instanced/extended
Update tests to test for new exceptions implemented
Add skeleton class for delete, strings related to delete

Implement delete command, throwing InvalidTask
* Add deleteTask() to TaskList to support delete operation
Insert new tests for delete and invalid delete

Divide classes into packages before proceeding for ease of future organisation

Reformat Parser to better fit coding standard

commitResults.messageTitle: Add support for de/serialisation of Task/List
commitResults.messageBody:
Add de/serialisation of TaskList
* Calls de/serialisation of Task

Add de/serialisation of Task
* Split tokens by \255 (should not be an enter-able character!)

Add new exception for malformed data

Make Duke store tasklist every input loop
* Storage file specified by DukeBot constructor

New exception for write error

Fix bug with case not breaking in TaskList

Fix serialisation of TodoTask
If storage is malformed, make copy of file so the users data is not lost

commitResults.messageTitle: Initial implementation of LocalDateTime in tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Convert Deadline and Event tasks/commands to use LocalDateTime

Move parsing of Deadline and Event times to Parser

Introduce new Exception for Deadline and Event if time is not specified

Take in time in ISO format for initial implementation (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS)

commitResults.messageTitle: Update event to have end, Improve error handling
commitResults.messageBody:
Update event to have an end date, specified by /to

Improve error handling
* New exceptions for empty deadline date, empty event date and event end before event start
Handle exception previously uncaught

commitResults.messageTitle: Change format of event and deadline time
commitResults.messageBody: Change event and deadline time to more human friendly format

commitResults.messageTitle: Update tests for new date handling
commitResults.messageBody:
Update tests to work with the new date handling
* Test blank descriptions and dates more rigorously

commitResults.messageTitle: Update de/serialisation of tasks using new date
commitResults.messageBody: Made de/serialisation of tasks compatible with the new date format

Abstract duke output into its own class

Add a special separator when duke encounters an error

Test de/serialisation of deadline and event

Test parser and tasklist is able to add and delete 1 task

commitResults.messageTitle: Include javadocs for most public methods, Minor style fixes
Reformat classes to better suit standard
Added FindCommand class and supporting methods
Add support for find command in Duke
commitResults.messageBody: Enable Duke to use the find command
Update gradle config to use UTF-8 and run the correct Main class

commitResults.messageTitle: Format files to fit style guide

commitResults.messageBody:
Clean up some styling errors

Added descriptive comments for all classes
Add JavaFX to gradle config

commitResults.messageTitle: Move Duke class into package duke
Add JavaFX GUI, Deprecate CLI interface
commitResults.messageBody:
Add JavaFX GUI to Duke

Moved CLI interface of Duke to DukeCli, now deprecated

Refactored DukeBot to handle input without a scanner
Tidy method names to better fit coding standard (thanks @tashawan23!)

Update build.grade to correctly run Launcher

Fix redundant import from MainWindow

Fix Main not having newline before EOF

commitResults.messageTitle: Catch edge case with indexed tasks
commitResults.messageBody: Catch zero/negative indexed tasks
Fix more styling issues, add javadoc support for UTF-8

commitResults.messageTitle: Add assertions to ensure code integrity

commitResults.messageBody: Fix some quality issues (thanks @seaniy !)

commitResults.messageTitle: Change Unix permissions for shell scripts
Change all line endings to LF from CRLF
Add newline at EOF to input redirection tests

commitResults.messageBody:
Refactor date handling in Duke to accept more human friendly date

Extract magic strings into DukeString

Add snooze functionality to Duke

Similar syntax to deadline/event (/at /by /to)

Usage:
snooze idx /at/by date1 (/to date2)

commitResults.messageTitle: Extract cases from parseInput to methods
commitResults.messageBody: Extract long cases from parseInput to individual methods to better fit code quality standards
Add graceful exit to GUI via bye command

Update GUI title to say 'Duke'
Add Ui screenshot for user guide
